intro: Leptocaulis divaricatus, commonly known as the variable-leaved flax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense spikes, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
